subject: Re: [junit] assertArrayEquals on arrays of objects
msgSnippet: If your classes, and those methods are not final, you can just have the tests extend the class providing the required equals method. I am not advocating doing
messageBody:
If your classes, and those methods are not final, you can just have the
tests extend the class providing the required equals method.

I am not advocating doing the above... just pointing out that there is no
need to use a mocking framework...


On 19 November 2012 11:15, Tomek Kaczanowski <kaczanowski.tomek@...>wrote:

> Hi Matthew,
>
> I wonder if you really can mock equals/hashcode - from what I remember
> most popular frameworks (i.e. Mockito) can't:
> "Cannot mock equals(), hashCode(). Firstly, you should not mock those
> methods. Secondly, Mockito defines and depends upon a specific
> implementation of these methods. Redefining them might break Mockito."
> (from http://code.google.com/p/mockito/wiki/FAQ)
>
> --
> Regards / Pozdrawiam
> Tomek Kaczanowski
> http://practicalunittesting.com
>
